topic.title: HPE Helion 1.0 Development Platform: Community Installation and Configuration

body.p: NOTE: This is the most current release of Helion Development Platform Community edition. If you are installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Commercial edition, follow the HPE Helion Development Commercial Installation and Configuration instructions instead.
The HPE Helion Development Platform currently contains four products: Application Lifecycle Service (ALS), Marketplace Service, Messaging Service and Database Service.
The following topics explain how to install and configure the HPE Helion Development Platform.

li.xref: Installing the HPE Helion Development Platform

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The HPE Helion Development Platform is installed in the overcloud of HPE Helion OpenStack

The system running the installer needs to have Python 2.7. Most modern operating systems include this as part of their base toolkit. This document is geared toward a Linux operating system but this does not preclude the installer from running on other operating systems with some minor modifications to the command-line statements used in this document.
The installer requires the following packages. If they are not found, it will prompt you to install them.
Use the following command:

codeblock.codeph: sudo apt-get install -y python-dev libffi-dev libssl-dev python-virtualenv python-pip

section.title: Installing the HPE Helion Development Platform
section.p: This section describes how to download and install the HPE Helion Development Platform.

li.xref: Downloading and unpacking the installation file

section.title: Downloading and unpacking the installation file
section.p: The installation of the HPE Helion Development Platform for the HPE Helion OpenStack Community Edition is provided as a small compressed TAR file. The images for the actual services will be downloaded by the installer.
Note: Should you need more assistance during installation, the install script also has a help feature.

li.p: Register and download the package from the following URL: HPE Helion Development Platform
Before you begin the installation, unpack the tar file.
Run this command to create and populate a dev-platform-installer directory.
If your network uses a proxy, it may be necessary to set the proxy shell variable.

codeblock.codeph: export https_proxy=<ip address or url of http proxy>

li.p: Run this command to prepare the installer and ensure prerequisites are met.
Optionally, you can specify the Username, Tenant and Region at this time. By default the Username is admin, the Tenant Name is admin and the Region is regionOne.

section.title: Install the Messaging Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Messaging service.

li.xref: Download and Configure the Messaging Service

li.p: Open Horizon and login as the Admin user. Then click on the Admin panel in Horizon and select Development Platform. Finally, click Configure Services.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network.
If you do not have an account, click the Sign-up button.

section.title: Download and Configure the Messaging Service

li.p: As the Admin user, in the Configure Services panel locate the Messaging item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.
After the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to configure the Messaging service and wait for the configuration step to complete.
Log out of the Horizon dashboard.
Log back into the Horizon dashboard as a non-admin user and click on the Messaging panel under the current project to begin using the Messaging Service.

section.title: Install the Application Lifecycle Service (ALS)
section.p: This section provides details on installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Application Lifecycle service.

li.xref: Download and Configure the Application Lifecycle Service

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: For the Application Lifecycle service to install dependencies for deployed applications, you must provide Application Lifecycle service with outbound Internet connectivity.

This process is documented in Step 7 of "Starting the seed and building your cloud" in the baremetal installation instructions. If an HTTP Proxy is required for Internet downloads, follow the instructions in the Administration Guide.

li.p: Open Horizon and login as the Admin user. Then click on the Admin panel in Horizon and select Development Platform. Finally, click the Configure Services sub-panel.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your user name and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network.
If you do not have an account, click the Sign-up button.

section.title: Download and Configure the Application Lifecycle Service

li.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Application Lifecycle Service item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.
After the download is complete, click Configure Service to configure the Application Lifecycle service and wait for the configuration step to complete.
Log out from the Horizon dashboard.
Log back into the Horizon dashboard as a non-admin user and click the Application Lifecycle Service panel under the current project to being using Application Lifecycle services.

section.title: Install the Database Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Database service.

li.xref: Download and Configure the Database Service

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Before installing, make sure the following prerequisites are met:

section.title: Configure the Service Network
section.p: The Database service needs an additional network for administrative purposes. This network is currently not used in Community edition but must exist in order for Database Service to properly install.

li.p: Open Horizon and login as the Admin user.
Click Project.
Click Network and then the Networks tab.
Click Create Network.
In Network Name field, enter SVC for the name of the network.
Click Next.
In the Network Address field, enter a CIDR that does not conflict with other services (such as: 172.10.0.0/24).
Click Next.
Click Create.

section.title: Check Project Quotas
section.p: The Database service will be installed into the Adminproject of the HPE Helion OpenStack overcloud. The Admin project must have sufficient quotas available for the service to use. To check existing quota availability, log in to Horizon as the Admin user and open the Overview panel under the Compute tab.
For the Community edition, the Database service requires that the Admin project have the following quotas available:

In addition to the quotas mentioned above, for every database instance that is created by a user, the necessary resources to create that instance will be deducted from the Admin project quota. The users Database service quota will also be affected.

li.p: Open Horizon and login as the Admin user. Then click on the Admin panel in Horizon and select the Development Platform panel under Admin. Then click the Configure Services sub-panel.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network.
If you do not have an account, click Sign-up.

section.title: Download and Configure the Database Service
section.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Database Service item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.

li.p: Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to begin configuration of the service. In the configuration dialog, specify the following configuration options:
Key Pair (Required) - Enter the name of the key pair to install on all instances created as part of the Database service. The public key can be used by an admin to get SSH access to all instances.
External Network (Required) - Enter the name of the network of the network that has external network access. For HPE Helion OpenStack Community edition this network is named 'ext-net'
NTP Server IP - Enter the IP Address to an NTP server to use if instances will not have outbound access to the internet.
Service User Password (Required) - Enter the password for the Admin user that is currently logged in. This password MUST match the password used to login to Horizon.
Icinga User Password (Required) - Icinga is not available in HPE Helion Development Platform Community Edition. However, a value must be specified. Enter any value.
Volume Type (Required) - Enter the volume type to use when creating database instances.
Service Network (Required) - Select the 'SVC' network created in Configure the Service Network.
RabbitMQ IP Address (Required) - Enter '127.0.0.1' for this parameter.
After all configuration options have been provided, select the Configure button to complete the configuration step. Wait for the configuration step to complete and the status to change to Configured.
Attach a Floating IP to API Service:
a. As the Admin user, in Horizon click Compute.
b. Click Instances.
c. Click More/Associate Floating IP for the trove-trove0_api... Instance.
d. Select an available IP or allocate a new one from the ext-net Network.
e. Select the port for trove-trove0_api... on the trove_mgmt_network
f. Click Associate

Recreate the service endpoint for Database service. This step should be performed from the command line on the controller management node or the base node. You will need the admin credentials and network connectivity to the overcloud.
Delete the old service endpoint and create a new service endpoint with a floating IP address from above using the following command:

codeblock.codeph: floating_ip=replace_with_floating_ip_allocated_above; service_id=`keystone service-get database | grep id | awk '{print $4}'`; endpoint_id=`keystone endpoint-list | grep $service_id | awk '{print $2}'`;keystone endpoint-delete $endpoint_id; keystone endpoint-create --service-id $service_id --region regionOne --publicurl "http://$floating_ip:8779/v1.0/\$(tenant_id)s" --adminurl "http://$floating_ip:8779/v1.0/\$(tenant_id)s" --internalurl "http://$floating_ip:8779/v1.0/\$(tenant_id)s"

li.p: Log out from the Horizon dashboard.
Log back into the Horizon dashboard as a non-admin user and click on the Database panel under the current Project to being using Database Service.

section.title: Install the Marketplace Service
section.p: This section provides details on installing the HPE Helion Development Platform Marketplace service.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Before installing, make sure the following prerequisites are met:

section.title: Check Project Quotas
section.p: The Marketplace service will be installed into the Admin project of the HPE Helion OpenStack overcloud. The Admin project must have sufficient quota available and unused for the resources the service uses.
To check existing quota availability:

li.p: Log in to Horizon as the admin user.
Open the Overview panel under the Compute tab.
The quotas should meet or exceed the following:
Open Horizon and login as the "admin" user. Then click on the admin panel in Horizon and select the Development Platform Panel under Admin. Then click on the Configure Services sub-panel.
Click the Connect button on the Configure Services panel and enter your username and password for the HPE Cloud OS Content Delivery Network. Select the Sign-up button if you do not have an account.

section.title: Download and Configure the Marketplace Service
section.p: In the Configure Services panel locate the Marketplace item in the Configure Services table and select Download Service and wait for the download to complete.

li.p: Once the download is complete, click the Configure Service button to begin configuration of the service. In the configuration dialog, specify the following configuration options:
Key Pair (Required) - Enter the name of the key pair to install on all instances created as part of the marketplace service. The public key can be used by an admin to get SSH access to all instances.
External Network (Required) - Enter the name of the network of the network that has external network access. For HPE Helion OpenStack Community Edition this network is named 'ext-net'.
NTP Server IP - Enter the IP Address to an NTP server to use if instances will not have outbound access to the internet.
Service User Password (Required) - Enter the password for the Admin user that is currently logged in. This password MUST match the password used to login to Horizon.
Subnet Range - Enter the subnet to use for Marketplace.
Do not attempt to install any Marketplace packages yet. Log out from the Horizon dashboard.
Log back into the Horizon dashboard and click on the Marketplace panel under the current Project to begin using the Marketplace Service. You may now install Marketplace packages.

section.title: Troubleshooting
section.p: Refer to the following topics if you experience problems with the installation.

section.title: Service is stuck in download
section.p: There are situations in which a download will not complete. One cause which is documented, is because the tmp directory ran out of space. There is a prerequisite to mount the tmp directory to a larger partition. If you have completed this step and the download is still failing, then we will need to reset the download. In the current release, this requires a manual process.

As the admin user, in the Admin project, click on Project, then Object Store. Open the sherpa-cache folder and delete the wscatalog.<id> folder which contains the cached download. The service should now be available to download again.
